data.text: @tristenlila I stopped with like 10 minutes left. & after seeing part of Cardi’s live talking about it, they both look bad in my opinion. The MUA got her feelings hurt because she was a fan and Cardi was being unnecessarily extra.
@CakeFaceShawtyy I hope you finished the video. Cardi treated that woman wrong.
@La_Petite_Nerd Girl you came on MY tweet mad at MY opinion. That’s a personal issue because nobody is asking you repeat the same thing that I obviously don’t agree with 🙃

@La_Petite_Nerd If you explain to the client what you are doing and show the important steps you are doing, they will be fine. But you sit there like a sad puppy because this celebrity isn’t all happy go lucky that you’re a fan isn’t an excuse to not communicate during the service.

@La_Petite_Nerd As a mua, you job is to make your client happy. And a client who is constantly getting her makeup done knows what she wants and doesn’t want. It’s not right for Cardi to cuss anyone out but ole girl can’t play the victim.

@La_Petite_Nerd I’ve had clients like that weren’t even celebrities. So I can only imagine a celebrity, who already was in a bad mood, would be on point with what they want & question what I’m doing. Just do your job, & go.

@La_Petite_Nerd @bisexualgawd The first tweet was only 2 minutes in. The second was half way through. The tweet you responded to was with about 10 minutes left. She wasn’t getting cussed out before she did her job. Pressure was applied and she was uncomfortable.

@jvsminxse I didn’t make it to the end lol. Halfway through I gave up because all MUAs know that the job is never perfect and these are things you’ll deal with. But going online to talk about it like this can EASILY stop other celebrities from contacting her

@bisexualgawd She wanted Cardi to be happy that she was a fan when really she should have just kept the whole thing professional, did her job, & left. Celebrities moving and looking doesn’t shock me. They have a million things to do and want to make sure they like their makeup 🤷🏽‍♀️

@bisexualgawd I didn’t fully finish it. But I just don’t think she should have done the video. You were warned she was in a bad mood and you’re upset that she was checking to see if the makeup was being done to her liking..

I mean, someone who gets their makeup done professionally damn near every day, I’m pretty sure they know what to expect, what they like/dislike. Idk, this video just seems like clout chasing lol. Especially if y’all were warned she’s already in a bad mood. GIGO 🤷🏽‍♀️
